qa_pairs.question: How did Lendico's expansion strategy reflect its relationship with Rocket Internet, and which countries did it enter during its initial phase?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Lendico's expansion strategy reflected its relationship with Rocket Internet by replicating the expansion plan typically used by its creator, Rocket Internet, during its initial phase.<cite>[S10]</cite></statement><statement>During its initial phase, Lendico entered Spain, Poland, Austria, South Africa, the Netherlands, and Brazil after launching in Germany.<cite>[S4][S10]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Lendico


# Lendico



**Lendico** was a multinational company, operating a peer-to-peer lending platform. [S2] It was taken over by Dutch bank ING Groep in early 2018 and now operates as a subsidiary. [S3] The international online marketplace for business and consumer lending was founded in December 2013 by the incubator and venture capitalist, Rocket Internet. [S4] After launching in Germany, the company expanded into Spain, Poland, Austria, South Africa, the Netherlands and Brazil. [S5] Using the crowdfunding model, the company based in Berlin, Germany, directly connects investors and private and business borrowers. [S6] Lendico is led by Friedrich Hubel and co-founder Clemens Paschke. [S7] Currently, Lendico Brazil still exists but is an independent company from Lendico Global Services. [S8] ## History

Founded in December 2013 in Berlin, Lendico's idea was to take to Germany, and to all of Europe, a lending model that was successful in the United States, peer to peer lending, or lending between people. [S9] Inspired by the business model of the US peer-to-peer lending platform Lending Club and UK based company Zopa, Lendico is a marketplace that enables the link between borrowers and investors. [S10] During the first 20 months, the company established itself in Austria, Brazil, the Netherlands, Poland, Spain and South Africa, replicating the expansion plan usually used by its creator, Rocket Internet. [S11] ## Business Model

The loans are personal loans or SME loans and range between €1,000 - €150,000 in Germany. [S12] The interest fee is calculated on the basis of the borrower’s credit score, credit history, desired loan amount and the borrower’s debt-to-income ratio. [S13] Lendico determines whether the borrower is creditworthy and assigns to its approved loans a credit grade that determines the payable interest rate and the fees. [S14] The loan period can range between 1 and 5 years and be repaid at any time. [S15] Only 10% of applications are received on the platform. [S16] Lendico operates completely online with no branch network and relies on proprietary technology to reduce costs and optimize the handling of loan applications. [S17] Lendico has repeatedly been nominated as best credit marketplace. [S18] In August 2015 Deutsche Börse Venture Network selected Lendico to become member of its programme of growth companies and national and international investors.

# Lendico

[S4] After launching in Germany, the company expanded into Spain, Poland, Austria, South Africa, the Netherlands and Brazil. [S5] Using the crowdfunding model, the company based in Berlin, Germany, directly connects investors and private and business borrowers. [S6] Lendico is led by Friedrich Hubel and co-founder Clemens Paschke. [S7] Currently, Lendico Brazil still exists but is an independent company from Lendico Global Services. [S8] ## History

Founded in December 2013 in Berlin, Lendico's idea was to take to Germany, and to all of Europe, a lending model that was successful in the United States, peer to peer lending, or lending between people. [S9] Inspired by the business model of the US peer-to-peer lending platform Lending Club and UK based company Zopa, Lendico is a marketplace that enables the link between borrowers and investors. [S12] The interest fee is calculated on the basis of the borrower’s credit score, credit history, desired loan amount and the borrower’s debt-to-income ratio. [S13] Lendico determines whether the borrower is creditworthy and assigns to its approved loans a credit grade that determines the payable interest rate and the fees. [S14] The loan period can range between 1 and 5 years and be repaid at any time. [S15] Only 10% of applications are received on the platform. [S16] Lendico operates completely online with no branch network and relies on proprietary technology to reduce costs and optimize the handling of loan applications. [S17] Lendico has repeatedly been nominated as best credit marketplace. qa_pairs.question: What factors determine the interest rate for loans on Lendico's platform, and how does the company assess borrower creditworthiness?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The interest rate for loans on Lendico's platform is determined by the borrower’s credit score, credit history, desired loan amount, and debt-to-income ratio.<cite>[S12]</cite></statement> <statement>Lendico assesses borrower creditworthiness by evaluating these factors and assigning a credit grade, which directly influences the payable interest rate and fees for approved loans.<cite>[S13]</cite></statement>

qa_pairs.question: What are the key features of Lendico's loan offerings, and what percentage of applications are typically accepted on the platform?
